subject: Re: WEB Project moving foreward
msgSnippet: It s hard to say what dialect it s in exactly. It should be completely readable to any English speaker, and if not, that s why collaborating is such a good
messageBody:
It's hard to say what dialect it's in exactly. It should be completely readable to any English speaker, and if not, that's why collaborating is such a good idea. The book of Philemon is finished and available from the project site if you want to see how things look so far :)

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Michael Everson <everson@...> wrote:
>
> I'm looking for the final text of Alice, since I guess I've had all the comments I can expect on the fonts. Was it ever prepared? And is it in British English? ;-)
>
> On 3 Apr 2012, at 00:47, Timothy wrote:
>
> > After much delay and technical hurdles, getting the WEB translation of the Bible into Quikscript is finally getting on its way. The work is being hosted on Sourceforge and anyone who is interested in helping is more than welcome to help. The tool that's been selected to finish out the project is Bibledit, which works perfectly on any Debian-based Linux and, according to the developer, on Windows and OSX.
> >
> > Every word will have to be checked, which is probably a good thing. Let's get the world's bestseller into this awesome alphabet, and go from there.
> >
> > http://sourceforge.net/projects/web-qs/
> >
> >
>
> Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
>
